reviews.text: Beautiful serene atmosphere. Open until 5 pm weekdays. Sunday mass at 10am and 5pm. Its a history place . If you are stressed and need some calm environment go here. It has an adoration chapel on the side which is also open with a security code.

Wonderful cathedral - probably the best in the Maritimes, certainly the grandest. It is something that must be seen to be truly appreciated, and if you are in the area don't think about passing it by.
One thing to be cautious of is the fact that it gets very busy in the summer months. Parking is rare to find, so maybe plan ahead.

A beautiful cathedral, inside and out. Admission was free but donations were accepted. They ask that you dress respectfully and not take pictures while services are in session (both very reasonable requests). 
You can walk right up to the front and see the sculptures and everything up close. Very close to a number of other downtown attractions - worth a visit.
This was great soon as I asked jesus to forgive me for all badness he said notta prob dan. Polished my halo and off I went!!!

A short walk from the port This Basilica stand out,  gracefully and beautifully in the old town of Charlottetown!  I truly enjoyed the stain glass panels and the various alters!  Don’t miss the carved in wood last supper under the main alter!

A lovely Neo-Classical style building to visit!

Free admission. Keep in mind that there are no self-guided tours, so you must take the guided tour. Our guide was very knowledgeable and was able to answer our questions.

Open to the public in July and August. Free tours are offered daily. The tours are very informative and interesting. Typically spend about 30-60 minutes here. If you are lucky you may even catch a glimpse of the Lieutenant Governor!

Lovely grounds and staff. We were there to welcome the right honorable Julie Payette during her first official visit to PEI ("but I've been here many times in a previous life", she said. There is a leaky gutter on the north-eastern side so one star off.
Officially closes at 4pm but they don't let you in after 3:45pm. Would have been nice to quickly visit inside.
Beautiful rooms interesting to see the period furniture. Good guide.
Dated and boring but good information about who Canada was formed.

A fascinating place to visit for anyone interested in the formation of Canada. As a Canadian it was a real eye opener as to the politics that lead to the signing of Confederation. Great place to visit for Canadian history buffs.
Great for Canadian history but this place needs a serious update - started to look a little dated.
A interesting way to learn about Canadian History (esp. for an American).
Здесь можно узнать о всех тур поездках по городу и купить билеты на все атракционы и спектакли

Our guide, Luke, was fantastic!! Very knowledgeable and friendly. I like history, anyways, but he brought the story to life with interesting tidbits. Fascinating details about the architecture and furnishings. A great way to learn about the Victorian era in PEI and a perfect way to spend a chilly springtime afternoon.

A lovely historic Victorian era home on the waterfront. Tours/entry is only 5$CAD per person, so why not take the tour? 

I did feel, however, that our tour guide could’ve used a bit of improvement- she seemed a bit nervous, and not very talkative. Otherwise, it is well worth a visit. 

The grounds themselves are well-maintained, and connect with a waterfront walking trail.
Love the carriage house beautiful place for the blue grass concerts

Will take tour next time we are in Charlottetown, BUT very big props to the staff. Last Tuesday, our son had to use their washroom just as they were closing for the day. They let us in & he took his eyeglasses off in the stall & left them in there. None of us noticed this. We left PEI without knowing where they had disappeared to. When we were 1 hour from home in the Toronto area we finally retraced our steps correctly and realized that they were likely there & maybe staff collected them & kept them safe until somebody claimed them. We spoke to them the next morning & today they arrived. If you are heading to Charlottetown soon, please take a tour of this beautiful house for us. Fantastic people working there!
This place is a purely awesome place to go to. When you are here it is very informative and nice. The guide is very friendly and makes the history interesting.

Its a wonderful park with something for everyone. It has a great children's playground, with everything you would expect, with swings, sliders...sand pits, climbing frames and more challenging things for bigger kids...there is a skateboard park, and a duck pond. There are gardens full of flowers to enjoy, tennis,bowls and golf, put and play and crazy golf..tea shops toilets and ice cream and a bandstand

Probably the most amazing free outdoor children’s park I’ve ever been to. The range of equipment is vast! Several wonderful jungle gyms, with slides varying from beginners level all the way to this humongous tunnel slide which actually I’d quite like to get on myself!! 

With sandpits and climbing walls, a zip wire and so many swings, two double swings (for two children or an adult and a little one) one fully backed swing, lots of regular ones and even two of those big circle rope ones. 

There is also a cafe with toilets attached however I believe there is a charge for these so bring change.

There is also a nice ratio of sunny to shaded areas.

I’d happily bring the children here one morning with picnic blankets and food and spend the whole day !!

We had very nice time walking around the park. It's big, it's beautiful and have a lot of space for activities. Just take your blanket and picnic basket and head to Victoria Park for a lovely day :)
And Botanical Garden next to it is just magical. Perfect place to spend a day enjoying great weather, beautiful area and walking.

Lovely park for a wall and some fresh air. 
Had a picnic by the duck  pond, with my baby. Lots of ducks for children to feed. Lovely and clean, no litter anywhere,  lots  of benches to sit on.
We never went in the park, as my baby is only 11 weeks, but in time, we will. 
We'll  be back
Fabulous park, something for everyone. Family friendly play area which has a huge range of play equipment for all ages. Also love the botanic gardens and big open spaces for picnics
Very yummy vegetarian burger. Simple somehow so good. They have more choices. The wrap was good too. Thumbs up.
Some of the best fish & chips in town. Staff are friendly and efficient. A preferred lunch option.
Incredible food in a cozy atmosphere.  The management/service team is spot-on, and the experience is exceptional each and every time we go.  Ryan and the gang know where it's at.

Always exceptional dishes and service. A loyal customer since 1990. One of my all time favourite restaurants. Comfortable and welcoming. And the food... I've haven't been disappointed yet. Plus good value for money! There's nothing not to like here.

The service staff here are pleasant and helpful. The food is quite good, their vegan options are nice filling, and the servers know enough about the kitchen to work with you. They catered wonderfully to both vegans, omnivores, and gluten sensitivities in my group. Nothing blew anyone out of the water, but it was good food, and well priced. I had a lovely time. Thank you!

Had the calamari and beet salad. Both were delicious, the calamari was crispy and very tender. Not greasy at all. The beet salad had a kick to it, maybe spiced beets or pecans but it was awesome. Our server  was great as well.

Great beer. Try the Black Banks Cascadian Dark Ale, it’s exquisite.

Fresh oysters were delicious.

Bartender was excellent. Great service and very knowledgeable about the area.

If your in Charlottetown I highly recommend Gahan House.

The food was delicious (got the 1/2 order of nachos 🤤), and the staff were very accommodating of our very large and growing group. Plus our waitress was very kind and very good at her job. 100% recommend! 👏🏼
Food and service was out of this world! We were in the basement so we could see all of the brewery,  not once did we feel forgotten! Definitely a must do again
It's a great place for friends hanging up. The oysters are always fresh, very satisfying with a glass of craft beer.Cheers~
Love their green tea milk tea! And their customer service is great! If you haven't been yet, you have to go!
Great milk tea!
Already purchase many times! Best bubble tea in the town! Taste just like the milk tea I loved in my hometown. Love it!!!
Great location for a delicious beverage. Friendly staff. Kids loved their drinks.

Located on the 2nd floor of the Confederation Court mall. 

I ordered the strawberry slush from here expecting it to be using real fruits in the drink but it's pretty much strawberry milk tea slush. Tasted really artificial and powdery. I did not like the flavour all. 

The drink wasn't good but service was great though. I would probably recommend going for the tea flavours rather than the milk versions.

The food was pretty good! Until I bit into something shiny in it.. Turns out it was steel wool and according to staff, that couldn't have been their fault.. Not sure what you guys clean with, but I don't eat with steel wool.
Very friendly and clean, the food was delicious. I highly recommend you try it
The food was decent, the beef used in the broccoli and beef was really chewy and tasted off though. Wouldn't buy it again, but the eggrolls and dumplings were great.
Great restaurant with a pretty large menu, we prefer to get a family meal with several large plates plus rice and an egg roll that is all shared. Restaurant was quite cold which was unfortunate.
Really good food. Great service. Check out their dinner buffets....very good and priced very fair.
Customer services are good. The prices  are reasonable. I came out with full satisfied lunch for less amount.

Garden salad with extra lobster and OH MY i was not dissapointed!! Huge heaping portion of lobster, very quick and friendly service, would definitely recommend and go back! (Food was both generous and tasty, photo is after i started eating already..!!!!)
Absolutely delicious. The fish was perfectly fried. And the atmosphere was great too especially since it's the oldest building on the block.
Good service. Good coffee, Fantastic curry sauce. Hawaiian burger was tasty but in retrospect I should have poured the curry sauce on it, yum! Next time!

Huge portions, fantastic food, and real great service. The fish and chips are worth every penny. Huge fillets. I was pleasantly surprised when we stumbled across the place. The prices are moderate but considering the amount of good food you get  for the price its well worth your time. Me and my boyfriend both left feeling full and beyond satisfied and even had enough take home for supper.
We always have to go to Cows when in Banff. We first went to the PEI location. We were so excited to find Cows in Banff so many years ago. We still have that excitement today.
Delicious, smooth, and creamy hard ice cream! Stop in for a scoop or 2, you won't regret it!
Delicious, long line up, but it moved quickly and well worth the 10 minute wait.

Whenever I go to banff and I'm craving something sweet, I always make sure to stop by my favourite ice cream store for some delicious treats! The ice cream is so good and there's so many flavours to choose from! You can also get a triple scoop option which us great if you have a sweet tooth like me! It's also an affordable option
I have been to Cows in PEI like 30 years ago. Very cool, super nice guys and we loved our icecream.
